ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: 1. Motivation for Close Family/Spouse/Partner Relationships
Notes: 0= No Impairment; 1= Mild deficit; 2= Moderate Deficit; 3= Moderately Severe Deficit; 4= Severe deficit

ElementDescription: 2. Motivation for Close Friendships/Romantic Relationships
Notes: 0= No Impairment; 1= Mild deficit; 2= Moderate Deficit; 3= Moderately Severe Deficit; 4= Severe deficit

ElementDescription: 3. Frequency of Pleasurable Social Activities - Past Week
Notes: 0= No Impairment; 1= Mild deficit; 2= Moderate Deficit; 3= Moderately Severe Deficit; 4= Severe deficit

ElementDescription: 4. Frequency of Expected Pleasurable Social Activities - Next Week
Notes: 0= No Impairment; 1= Mild deficit; 2= Moderate Deficit; 3= Moderately Severe Deficit; 4= Severe deficit

ElementDescription: 5. Motivation for Work and School Activities
Notes: 0= No Impairment; 1= Mild deficit; 2= Moderate Deficit; 3= Moderately Severe Deficit; 4= Severe deficit

ElementDescription: 6. Expected Pleasurable Work and School Activities - Next Week
Notes: 0= No Impairment; 1= Mild deficit; 2= Moderate Deficit; 3= Moderately Severe Deficit; 4= Severe deficit

ElementDescription: 7. Motivation for Recreational Activities
Notes: 0= No Impairment; 1= Mild deficit; 2= Moderate Deficit; 3= Moderately Severe Deficit; 4= Severe deficit

ElementDescription: 8. Frequency of Pleasurable Recreational Activities - Past Week
Notes: 0= No Impairment; 1= Mild deficit; 2= Moderate Deficit; 3= Moderately Severe Deficit; 4= Severe deficit

ElementDescription: 9. Frequency of Expected Pleasure from Recreational Activities - Next Week
Notes: 0= No Impairment; 1= Mild deficit; 2= Moderate Deficit; 3= Moderately Severe Deficit; 4= Severe deficit

ElementDescription: Motivation and Pleasure Total Score (questions 1-9 added)
10. Facial Expression
Notes: 0= No Impairment; 1= Mild deficit; 2= Moderate Deficit; 3= Moderately Severe Deficit; 4= Severe deficit

ElementDescription: 11. Vocal Expression
Notes: 0= No Impairment; 1= Mild deficit; 2= Moderate Deficit; 3= Moderately Severe Deficit; 4= Severe deficit

ElementDescription: 12. Expressive Gestures
Notes: 0= No Impairment; 1= Mild deficit; 2= Moderate Deficit; 3= Moderately Severe Deficit; 4= Severe deficit

ElementDescription: 13. Quantity of Speech
Notes: 0= No Impairment; 1= Mild deficit; 2= Moderate Deficit; 3= Moderately Severe Deficit; 4= Severe deficit

ElementDescription: Expression Items Total Score (questions 10-13 added)
CAINS Total Score (MAP_ssum + EXP_ssum)
Weeks since Treatment Session 1
Items Averaged within the Social domain
Items Averaged within the Vocational domain
Items Averaged within the Recreational domain
Items Averaged within the Expression domain
Staff code number of person completing this form

Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
